moves.1. Nf3 d5 2. d4 e6 3. c4 Nf6 4. g3 Be7 5:
Closed Catalan
Alternative variation: 6... c6 [ is a more common way to keep the position closed. The game could continue] 7. Qc2 Nbd7 8. b3 [with the option of 8...b6 or 8...b5 here.]
Alternative variation: 6... dxc4 [ is the strongest move, because White will need to eventually take time to recapture the pawn.] 7. Qc2 a6 8. Qxc4 b5 $11
moves.7. Qc2:
Not the most accurate move.
Alternative variation: 7. Nc3 Bb7 8. Ne5 Na6 9. b3 [ gives White a very nice position with a slight edge.]
moves.7... Nbd7: Alternative variation: 7... c5 [ seems to be the best way to take advantage of 7.Qc2. Black should now try to get his rook on the c-file.] 8. Nc3 Nc6 9. Rd1 Bb7 [with an even game.]
moves.8. Ne5: Alternative variation: 8. cxd5 [keeps the edge for White.] Nxd5 9. Nc3 $14
moves.8... Bb7: Alternative variation: 8... Nxe5 9. dxe5 Ng4 $15 [and White is having trouble defending the e5 pawn.]
moves.9. cxd5 exd5: Alternative variation: 9... Nxd5 [uses a nice tactic to defend against Ne5-c6.] 10. Nc6 Nb4 11. Nxb4 Bxg2 12. Kxg2 Bxb4 $11
moves.10. Nc6: Good move. Taking advantage of the hole on c6.
moves.10... Qe8: Alternative variation: 10... Bxc6 11. Qxc6 [ isn't any better for Black. The pawns on d5 and c7 are too weak to hold onto.]
moves.11. Nxe7+ Qxe7 12. Qxc7 Ba6 13. Re1:
Black has the opportunity to take a large lead in development here by harrassing White's queen.
Alternative variation: 13. Nc3 [ developing and protecting e5. If] Bxe2 14. Re1 [wins the bishop.]
moves.13... Qb4: Alternative variation: 13... Rfc8 14. Qf4 Ne4 [followed by Ne7-f6.]
moves.14. Qc3 Qe7 15. Qa3 Qe6: Alternative variation: 15... Qxa3 [only move.] 16. Nxa3 Rac8 [and White should be able to win in this position being up a pawn and having the bishop pair.]
moves.16. Qxa6 Rfc8 17. Nc3 Rc4 18. Bxd5 Nxd5: Game Summary: In the opening, White made a small inaccuracy with 7.Qc2. Black had a chance to equalize at that point by playing 7...c5 and grabbing space in the center. After 8.Ne5, Black could have weakened White's pawn structure with 8...Nxe5, also taking the initiative. White played a very strong game after that point taking advantage of a small mistake by black (9...exd5) and converting his edge to a win.
